The thing that made Portal 1 challenging was that the physics of it all took a little while to sink in for many people. Portal 2 didn't have the luxury of being a new concept; people who had played the first one already had that mindset (You know the one I mean) for thinking outside the box coming into this one. So they came up with new challenges, and frankly, I am impressed. Lots of fun, good humor and a sore forehead for hitting myself when I didn't think of the answer sooner.

Portal was great - But in some ways Portal 2 is even better. Enjoy the puzzle's, the environment and most importantly; enjoy the humor.

As portal should rightly say when compared to other puzzle games: I'm different

Замечательная игра! Просто замечательная! Что первая часть, что и вторая. Это одна игра, из тех не многих игр, которые мне действительно понравились, и я всем остался доволен. У меня просто нету слов! Да и нету таких слов в русском языке, которые могли-бы полностью описать эту игру. Наконец-то "Valve" сделали что-то действительно стоящее! 

Thanks, and have fun! © Gabe Newell.
Отличная игра! Всем советую...Кооператив великолепный и одиночка не отстает.

I missed Portal 1, despite the hype and am now sorry I did. I have found it to be one of the most original and enjoyable puzzle games on any gaming platform! I cant recommend it highly enough after just a couple of hours play! Its completely unique, has world class level design, and above all... Stephen Merchant as one of the ingame characters.. In the immortal words of Jim Bowen... It get's no better!

You know how there were several memes going around due to this game? The Space Core, Cave Johnson's exploding lemons, etcetera? Well, the rest of the game is much funnier. Portal 2 is a triumph in storytelling, comedy, gameplay, and most importantly, Aperture Science.
um dos melhores games que ja joguei na minha vida! (junto com portal 1 claro)
It makes you feel smart because the puzzles are really easy but you still feel like you accomplish something. A+ would play again

Portal 2! Now I did play the first Portal on the Xbox before hand. This game is a MUST HAVE for any gamer. The Story is so epic and the Characters are the funniest I have seen in most Video Games. The Test that you have to do are sometimes easy, but at the same time there are some that will just cause your brain to hurt! I did play through Co-op mode with a Friend and I sometimes found myself having to solve the Rooms on my own just because he gave up. But having to use all 4 Portals to find a way out was so hard compared to the normal 2 you use in the single player. This game I didn't go a whole lot into the modding just because I didn't feel like there was a whole lot that could be added to make it better than it was(Does that make any sence?). But the game is one I am probably going to play through again because it was so good!

No word could express this game

BUY IT!

10/10

This game is absolutely amazing. The puzzles can be deceptively simple but challenging, the single player campaign is a blast playing and then the Co-Op adds in a pair of robots that have more personality than any other virtual character I have ever seen. This game is worth getting and playing. :)

One of the best puzzle games of all time.

This is, quite simply, the most unique game in the world. Everyone should play it.
And there is so much to it: an exciting singleplayer campaign; interesting co-op campaign for 2 players with an intriguing ending; then there are "least portals placed" challenges to really make you think and speed challenges to test your skills (the challenges are especially good if you do them with a friend); and, of course, the most comfortable level editor ever, which allows people to make thousands of test chambers (which can be rated, so you can pick the best ones), so you can't say the game is repetitive...
I didn't say much about the gameplay itself, because a video can tell much more.

★★★★★★★★★★

Did you like the first game for it's dark humor? Now you can enjoy a game where that same dark humor is now 200% less subtle!

This game immediately alienates those who were familiar with the first title by throwing an updated version of the Source engine in the game, which gives a distinct disconnect between how you're controlling and what's actually onscreen compared to the first game. 

Artstyle is okay. The updated look of the Portals is pretty poor compared to the first game, and the only area of the game that really stood out visually was That Middle Section of the Game I won't describe because spoilers. The rest of the game suffers from too little white space with which to shoot portals. You have to go into the single player accepting the fact that you aren't playing Portal, a first person puzzle platformer, but Portal 2, a first person adventure game.

To go with the game's new role as an adventure game, the voice acting direction to lose all semblance of the bland robotic tone from the first game. Steven Merchant has hardly any distortion applied to his voice, and H.K. Simmons's script is literally nothing but one-off jokes that prevent the player from properly connecting with him. Ellen McLain is fine, nothing fantastic but she has to walk through the same sludge script as the rest of the cast. The script just sucks, too many blantant attempts at jokes, not enough off-kilter or black humor which helped lend the game its unique atmosphere. So many elements from Portal 1 are reused that you wonder why Valve bothered. 

Can't comment on multiplayer, have no interest getting frustrated trying to complete puzzles that are likely by Valve's standards 4 times as hard as single player ones. No comment on the workshop levels either, no experience with modding or level designing.

Game's lack of a true difficulty curve results in resetting at multiple points in the game while you learn new concepts instead of adding on to previously learned ones.

Plot is dumb, a bunch of material that stresses the plausability of a scenario I found perfectly reasonable in the first game by way of overexposition.

The singular most amazing, mind-boggling, brain-teasing and beautiful puzzler I have ever seen. 10/10. Well done. Valve, I salute you.
Edit: Even years after it's release, this is still an amazing game!

Portal 2 is the best strategy/puzzle game I have ever played. It combines a fantastic, detailed, and humorous story with serious gameplay that challenges your mind in a way no other game (except the original Portal) ever has. Try not to forget which way is down!

这游戏可以玩三遍：初玩一遍，开发者注释一遍，刷成就一遍

场景跨度非常大

游戏的开始还是从前作的实验室出发，一模一样的位置，令人会心一笑
前作干净透亮的实验室在本作中因为年久失修而变得破败，正好利用起源引擎制造出复杂的生锈、乱枝丛生、垃圾遍地的效果，细节丰富、自然又贴合剧情。即使更换了引擎，与前作在画质上的连贯性也非常强，也不会因为画质的提升而感到违和
前几个实验室还残留着破败的感觉，但是很快就回到了它该有的现代感。GlaDOS制作了更宽阔的实验室，色彩的基调也从前作的白色和褐色，变为了灰蓝色
落入早期的光圈实验室之后，场景骤然变大，解谜的空间跨度也更大。在深不见底的地下石洞中，远处传来不知来源的回声，视野里只有生锈的高塔、褪色的水泥墙、望不到头的栈道和不知道还要乘多久的升降梯，没有人，只有早就录好的语音在不停嘲讽自己
再次回到实验室，场景跟着剧情发生变化，不再是封闭的房间，而成为了开放的、露天的空间，糅合了前两种场景的特点的同时，也把之前所有出现过的道具都放到谜题里了

谜题的设置上，把前作讨厌的光炮换成了激光束，又添加了非常多的新元素
光桥、弹跳板和传送漏斗很好地利用了宽阔的场景进行大尺度的移动
红蓝两种凝胶能让主角跑得更快、跳得更高，白色凝胶则让游戏的自由度上升非常多

剧情虽然曲折，但是都在意料之中，比起前作令人惊艳的表现，剧情方便只能说差强人意。
有暗线有伏笔，还有和HL系列的neta联动
一如既往有不少黑色幽默，GlaDOS也是保持了刻薄的语气
比较有趣的是，本作的BOSS战正好和前作过程完成相反……

前作精致小巧，本作恢宏大气
不过结尾的歌没有前作好听了

Knowing virtually nothing about the game except that it involved "portals", this was a great surprise of a game. I love puzzle type games, but not ones that stumped me for hours. Solving the puzzles in this game were such fun, and many were quite creative. While a FPS style, you don't really shoot and kill stuff...but rather use the portal gun to solve puzzles. 

Great voice work by Stephen Merchant which kept things funny and cheeky while the environment crumbled around you. Great game, well done and high recommended!

This is one of the highest rated games in history, and for good reason; absolutely everything about it is amazing. If there is a game released within this decade that should be preserved for future generations, this should be it.

Can't really say enough about this game.  The story, the gameplay, the..  everything, it's all amazing.  The puzzles are beyond comparison, some taking minutes and others could take days to figure out.  Out of all of the games I've played in my life, I can't honestly think of many that would outdo Portal 2 in pure quality.  If you want an awesome game, pick it up NOW.
